result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac Uno Laplander was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The costs have been paid in full before sentencing.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Defendant Isaac Uno Laplander in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Defendant Isaac Uno Laplander in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.    Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Statements by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Nocco.  Statement by defendant. Court orders 15CF23 - imposed and stayed sentence of 3 years initial confinement followed by 3 years of extended supervision stayed placement on probation for 3 years with conditions of court costs; restitution of $500.00; DNA sample and surcharge; costs of transportation in the amount of $400.00; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Case No. 15CF24 - court orders imposed and stayed 1 year of initial confinement followed by 1 year extended supervision concurrent to 15CF23 probation for 3 years; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deed appropriate by probation agent.- rt
